title: Terms page, Home hero refresh with featured carousel, and dedicated Login/Signup routes (Internet Identity)

requirements.summary: Add a /terms route and render the provided Terms & Conditions copy with clear headings and numbered sections.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to /terms renders a Terms & Conditions page within the shared SiteLayout (header + footer).
The page displays the exact sections provided by the user (Use of Content, User Conduct, Intellectual Property, Privacy, Disclaimer, Modifications, Contact) with clear typography and spacing.
The page includes the line "Effective Date: [Insert Date]" as shown in the user-provided text (unless the app already has a configured effective date).
The page includes the contact email link: meesamali6829@gmail.com.

file_operations.description: Create a Terms & Conditions page that renders the user-provided professional Terms & Conditions copy with semantic headings, numbered sections, and a mailto link to meesamali6829@gmail.com; compose layout using existing Tailwind styles and shadcn-ui typography-friendly primitives if needed (e.g., Card) without editing ui components. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Register a new TanStack Router route for /terms and wire it into the existing routeTree so it renders within SiteLayout. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add header and footer navigation links to the Terms & Conditions page using existing TanStack Router link patterns.
acceptanceCriteria: Header navigation includes a "Terms" (or "Terms & Conditions") link that routes to /terms on desktop and mobile menus.
Footer "Quick Links" includes a link to the Terms & Conditions page.
All new links use the existing TanStack Router Link components and match current hover/active styling patterns.

file_operations.description: Add a new navigation entry for /terms (label "Terms" or "Terms & Conditions") to the existing desktop Button-as-Link nav and mobile menu list, keeping current styling/behavior. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add a Terms/Terms & Conditions entry to the existing Quick Links list, using the TanStack Router Link and matching current hover styling. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Update the Home page hero/banner headline, primary CTA, and background treatment to match the requested concept while keeping existing sections intact.
acceptanceCriteria: Home page hero headline displays exactly: “Explore Amazing Stories Every Day”.
Home page hero primary CTA button label displays exactly: “Read Stories” and navigates to /stories.
Hero background follows a clean light theme with a subtle abstract/gradient treatment (no heavy/distracting visuals), consistent with the existing site theme.
Existing Home page sections below the hero (e.g., featured stories and CTA) remain accessible and visually consistent after the update.

file_operations.description: Update hero headline text to exactly “Explore Amazing Stories Every Day”; update primary CTA button label to exactly “Read Stories” linking to /stories; adjust hero container background to a light/clean subtle abstract/gradient treatment consistent with current Tailwind theme; ensure existing sections below the hero remain unchanged in structure/access. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add a compact, subtle featured-stories motion element (carousel/animation) inside the Home hero that links to story detail pages.
acceptanceCriteria: The Home hero includes a compact animated element or carousel that shows 2–3 featured stories sourced from the existing featured stories dataset.
Each preview item can be clicked/tapped to navigate to the correct story detail route.
The motion/animation is subtle (no autoplay that disrupts reading), works on mobile, and respects existing accessibility expectations (e.g., controls are keyboard reachable if present).

file_operations.description: Create a small, lightweight featured-stories carousel component that consumes the existing getFeaturedStories() data and renders 2–3 preview items linking to the story detail route (/stories/$slug); include subtle transition (e.g., CSS-based) with explicit next/previous controls that are keyboard reachable and no disruptive autoplay. Use existing TanStack Router Link and optionally shadcn-ui Button/Card for consistent UI. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Wire the new FeaturedStoriesCarousel into the Home hero area (not below the fold), passing featured stories from the existing dataset and ensuring click navigates to the correct detail route; keep motion subtle and mobile-friendly. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add dedicated /login and /signup routes that trigger Internet Identity authentication and redirect appropriately after success; expose header entry points.
acceptanceCriteria: There is a dedicated Login page route (e.g., /login) with clear English UI text and a login action that triggers Internet Identity authentication using the existing Internet Identity hook.

There is a dedicated Signup page route (e.g., /signup) that also triggers Internet Identity authentication (signup can be presented as the same Internet Identity flow, but must be a separate page/route).
After a successful login/signup, the app redirects the user (at minimum: back to Home or to the page the user originally attempted to access, if that context is available).

If the user is already authenticated and visits /login or /signup, the UI shows an authenticated state (e.g., “You are already signed in”) and provides a clear navigation option (e.g., go to Home/Stories).
Header navigation exposes entry points to Login and Signup pages (desktop and mobile) without breaking existing nav layout.

file_operations.description: Create a dedicated /login page that uses the existing useInternetIdentity() hook to trigger Internet Identity login on user action; show clear English UI, handle already-authenticated state, and redirect after successful authentication (default Home; optionally honor a redirect/search param if available). Compose UI with existing Tailwind styling and shadcn-ui Button/Card where appropriate. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a dedicated /signup page with similar UX to /login but tailored copy for signing up; use the same Internet Identity login flow via useInternetIdentity(); show already-authenticated state and redirect on success (default Home; optionally honor a redirect/search param if available). Compose UI with existing Tailwind styling and shadcn-ui components. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Register TanStack Router routes for /login and /signup and add them to the routeTree so they render within SiteLayout. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add header navigation entry points for /login and /signup in both desktop and mobile navigation, using existing TanStack Router Link patterns and maintaining current styling/layout. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
